ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: On average, how many hours per day did you typically sleep
On average, how many of your waking hours do you typically spend by yourself per day
On average, how many of your waking hours do you typically spend with other people per day
How many of these hours are typically spent actively interacting with others (e.g. having a conversation, playing a game or another activity
How many of these hours are typically spent silently in the same space with others (e.g. quietly watching TV and not talking, reading or working close to others
On average, how many of your waking hours do you typically want to spend by yourself per day
On average, how many of your waking hours do you typically want to spend with other people per day
During the past three months, have you been spending more, less or the same amount of time by yourself than you used to
